title: Thomas Cook jobs saved as Hays Travel swoops on 555 stores
text:
Hundreds of Thomas Cook stores and staff have been thrown a lifeline after Hays Travel struck a deal to buy the failed company’s entire store portfolio.

The deal could save 555 stores across the country and is a boost for struggling British high streets.

Thomas Cook, the 178-year-old travel company, went bust just over two weeks ago, jeopardising 9,000 jobs in the UK and leaving 150,000 passengers stranded overseas.

A two-week repatriation programme led by the Civil Aviation Authority, which returned over 140,000 holiday makers, ended on Sunday. The estimated cost of the airlift is £100m.

Hays Travel’s management said: “Thomas Cook was a much-loved brand employing talented people. We look...
description: Hundreds of Thomas Cook stores and staff have been thrown a lifeline after Hays Travel struck a deal to buy the failed company’s entire store portfolio.
